content: You made this game too hard. The controls Mainly! You nee to put a Direction Pad instead of the one you have. The Game is Superb otherwise

I like this game and it's really good really fun and kind of of a puzzle game and it's about like criminals in the start. but one thing the boss is way too hard I cannot do the boss the first boss. So can you fix it please
A platformer my favourite type of gaming, except Boss fights are kind of out of place in this game and the bird is really annoying makes me not want to bother

Looks polished but the control is terrible, over sensitive. No easy walk over a ledge, you're thrown like a gust of wind, which is kind of a big deal when navigating electrical traps. Tried to give it a few days. Over it. It's one thing to have realish-tic jumping, another to not be able to walk. Also the ledge snap is overwrought. Can't bound over them, or drop down or leap from. Have to wait for the animation of climbing up. Bagh.
Fun game
So beautiful and you could tell they put so much effort great job

Lags on my f-in Pixel 4!! And I really doubt it's the amazing visual effects, it's just bad programming or malware or something... This thing can play flight simulator at 90 fps 4k so... it's not terrible in concept but the software as software isn't good enough. seriously a platformer that pulls 5 fps on a Pixel 4... 🙄
It's pretty fun, I've never finished it cuz it got too hard but the puzzles are fun to do also a little multiplayer mini game could be cool
I am glad I read a review that said to use a controller with this. Helped a lot out. With a controller you have so much better control with what you do. This game is very fun and challenging.
It is almost impossible to do anything timing based with the touch controls
Hmm. Game is very pretty, gameplay has too much physics jank to be honest. Anyway, 5 stars because we need more of that kind of thing on Android - premium games with decent controller support.
Only thing I have is it needs wi fi
This game is beautiful and would get 5 stars if not for the touch controls, which I don't know if there's a way to make it work on a phone
Great Gameplay, Great Graphics, Fun levels. Now on the down side.. Simple story, Disappionting Ending. Glad i got on sale for $0.99 dont think its worth full price
Can anyone please tell me why my game progress is gone? Same happened to Stardew valley, Space marshalls. Always logged to my Google play account... My other games are fine.
Fun game but unfortunately I had way too much stuttering for it to be playable.
Amazing even if my pixel 4 xl shakes under the graphical load. (Plz add graphics setting guys)
This is dope! Story and gameplay are amazing. Screen controls make the game more challenging, but thankfully you can use a controller.
It looks amazing 👌
This game is fun and enjoyable, took me 13hrs to finished! I would recommended this game for $5 but $10? definitely not, you should try to play this with Google pass is worth it.
I had fun playing this game it does get hard but worth paying for

*DO NOT PURCHASE IF YOU DON'T USE A CONTROLLER* I really want to give this game a 5* because it's gorgeous, has a great world, lovely puzzles, etc! But reality is that the game has too many actions for a touch screen. In many cases the issues are 'minor' (sensitive directional controls, accidental switching of ability, triggering of jump/shields, etc) but there are also many sections that sre almost unplayable. As a low-effort fix, more autosave points would be useful in demanding sections.

1 Your on ice in the air 2 You don't know how to beat the first boss so it's impossible 3 to beat the first boss you need to pull a pro move this game sucks right now I'll come back to this later see if it got better also there is no slow walk so plz fix that I belive this is a good game, a unpolished gem vary ugly (not ugly but more like a beta) and not polished

can't launch while offline, will force close after the playdigious logo screen, can only launch while connected, other than that it is good and being compatible with controllers is appreciated. Too bad that one needs internet access when playing this game, if you go on a trip where you don't have wifi or data you can forget about playing this, i just wish i could have known that in less than 2 hours after buying so i could refund, i was planning to play this somewhere else but i won't be able to
S20+ lags every few seconds, would love to play but I can't give 5 stars if it ain't compatible
Another potentially great Playdigious game ruined by terrible controls.

Fun! Love the really unique gameplay. The boss battles were quite clever and finding the secrets also require a bit of challenge. Overall a great game and definitely worth more than the price it's asking for! P.S. Highly recommended to play with bluetooth controller because touch screen will most definitely ruin the experience. EDIT: I read a review here saying the 8bitdo N30 controller doesn't work with this game and that's not true. I beat the entire game and collected all secrets with it!

A Nice platformer with positive and negative forces to magnetize objects and solve puzzles. Good looking visual and nice animations with a new perspective on action-puzzle creation makes this game kinda unique in is genre. The puzzles so far are more tricky than complicated or grandious, but the controls are a bit tricky to get used to, mostly because they stay close to the bottom of the screen. Change the controls to non floating for a better game play on phones, and use a gamepad preferably.
Nice game, but to laggy on my pixel 5
thoroughly enjoying this game. only problem i've had is lag in the forge section of the map though I suspect that's my fault for buying it on Android and not PC.
The game glitches at the most inconvent times. Also, the art style changes for the worse after level one
Too difficult even with a controller.
The controls are really bad. For some reason, I can punch to the ground with the blue color, but not with the red color.
Really great game. Neat ideas and refreshing game play.

I love how the challenge builds as you go, no need for a tutorial. The game starts and you are off learning about the world. The power ups are great and well thought. Gameplay is entertaining, challenging without being overwhelming. Oh, and the graphics are gorgeous too!
The control is so bad
Cannot be played completely offline...i know there's a verification process but it could have been a one time thing.
Doesn't work with the 8bitdo N30 controller... There's no button mapped to "punch", I can only run around and jump. Can't find any settings. Controller works perfect in other android games.
it lags at the robot factory, can play the game with this
Beautiful game but controls are not great.

Overall it was fun but once more and more moving parts were part of the puzzle the lag started to show. It was the worst at the molten blocks elevator part. I have a pixel 4 xl and the lag is just awful. There should be a setting to reduce the graphics.
amazing graphics.controls are slow and unresponsive at times.other then that game is well thought out.
Game deserves 5 stars but the vibration is incredibly distracting and not being able to turn that off literally has me quitting the game often just to make that stop.

I loved this game, only complaint is the controls. It's meant to be played with a controller, so touch controls can be insanely tight. If you can work through that it's so fun. One other thing is multiple glitches. The screen went black, kick to the main menu, then when I loaded back, I would be literally just past the puzzle I was trying to beat when it glitched. Seemed to happen when switching red/blue polarity multiple times fast over and over. One time it even gave me achievments.

Wow. Really good graphics. Reminds me of Another World. This is one of those have game that I can't put down on mobile - I can lose hours and hours and that is saying a lot! Most mobile games I just get bored quick due to ads, and pay to win scenario. But this... It's addictive! On par with Limbo, but better animation and graphics.

Don't use the standard controls. There is a lot of platforming and there are a lot of moments requiring tight controls. The static dpad makes the game playable, and a controller is even better. If you buy this game and don't change the controls, you will not get the best impression of the game. This is a good platform puzzler. Browse the reviews and you'll see a lot of praise, and they aren't wrong, but don't judge it based on its default settings.
A challenging but fair platformer with really charming art. The touch controls work pretty well but I have fat fingers so I prefer using a controller - Razer Kishi or DS4 if docked

The game is very good! Its animation is fluid and has good puzzles. The only bad thing is the movement control, it takes a long time to do the action and it is too much in the corner, making movement difficult.
can't get past bronze bull due to huge lags on flagship phone.
great with controller , sucks with touch controll
Beautiful game! Smart, atmospheric, non-violent. Pair a controller and you have a solid port in your hands. Thanks devs!
Fun

Great game and good graphics but controls are little difficult to use them, sometimes it feels lagging and when i try to move straight it moves in the wrong direction... overall the game is good just try to fixe some bug and improve the controls I'll give you 5 stars
Make an adjustments to controls, it's too precise for touch screens that some of the stages are impassable but all over the game's freakin' good🥰😍
controls need to be improved. objective and map needs to be clear.
Buen juego, al usar un Gamepad Es mucho mejor la experiencia del juego

The controls are terrible, don't bother with this garbage. If I could pay again to forget playing it I would, that's how frustrating they are. Unless you see a big fat update on controls scroll ahead.

Great job unique and interesting I like it could use some touch up on the controls but solid game keep up the good work

Difficult and fun gameplay alsome game overall. I really like how hard and complicated the puzzles are, and I really wanted to be more personal customization, but taking the fact that it's a story it's ok.
When I get to the forge and cooler areas it starts lagging and won't let me jump or teleport.
it was a really fun play, some of the puzzles and bosses were really hard but a fun challenge.

Perfect Prince...

Easy to learn, difficult to master. Primarily a platformer, your timing and spacing will be very important. Expect to die A LOT as you learn the puzzles and bosses. Russian magnet people theme is strong in the art style and it looks good. You get stuck in a courtyard after the final boss so you have to start over to re-vist the map.

The controls are a little too precise for touch screen (acceleration is awkward, punching is too short ranged, some jumps are too tight). The game also severely lags in the forge area even on a fresh reload and on a s10+. In general the concept is cool, I love metroidvanias on a phone, but it may be too hard for most people.

Shocking-ly good graphics. Not a game that you will ZAP through. Current-ly stuck. Puzzles will make wonder WATT are you going to do. Game is electrifying and will AMP you up. OHMan is this fun. PLUG in and TURN IT ON
Its ok now to play in android 11. Thankyou for concern

OK, weird intro.
Great game, although laggy at times, even on high-end phones

Mmmhh good it is

Not for everyone. There's no explanation, and no tutorial. Everything is presented to you so you can figure it out on your own. I personally love that. It's challenging and engages your imagination as it slowly presents more info about the world you're playing in. If you don't like trying to figure what to do next without using context clues, this isn't for you.
Simply amazing story.

Great! Extremely surprised at how well this game was. Do yourself a favor and use a Xbox or PS4 controller and you have a good time playing this game. There were a few bugs but nothing a fast restart didn't handle.

Very immersive. Challenging. There's no hints really, it's just a beautiful game that's tough and you have to figure it out on your own. It reminds me of all the og games where you could get stuck on one level for a week before you beat it lol.
I always looking for games like this. I hope you made another game like this but longer. Thanks for your work.

I'd give 5 stars however get to a certain spot and there is a brick missing to help get through where there's 3 electric spots where you are supposed to "phase" to get across. But if not for that it's a great game

I suppose this is inevitable in a game that relies heavily upon physics puzzles but in the maglev section the slab doesn't get enough momentum once it's charged to cross the gap and gets stopped short being repelled by the magnets that follow.

I love the game one of my favorite I have found on the app store my only problem is with the controls they are not bad at first but later in the game when you need to use fast actions it can get kind of difficult to do everything you need with the way the controls are set up but it's not enough to ruin the game
Good platformer I just wish there was more words but I guess that would defeat the point
Actually pretty boring. The game may get better but it definitely didnt grab me on the 1st level. All I kept thinking was "this was a premium paid game?" Had no idea what the point was.
Unique concept. Beautiful graphics and story. Get a controller. It's worth it.
Beautiful game. Challenging and deep. My only issue is with my own ability to be proficient with mobile controls for this platform. Makes you think and it's challenging. What more could you ask for.
great platformer sometimes laggy but thats normal on this device i use which is my chromebook. Solid play throughout best experience is on a controller though other wise it will feel really wonky
The gameplay sucks . No wonder this trash is on here for free. All the different controls options is terrible. Uninstalled.

Great game, love the look, but controls are a little frustrating on phone compared to legit console experience.
Pretty good game

Do not attempt to play this game without a controller! Some sections are very challenging and would be near impossible with mobile controls. The gameplay mechanics are very unique, and many of the puzzles are very unorthodox, to the point where you wonder if you solved it as intended, but either way, it can be very satisfying if you managed it without a walkthrough.
perfect
A Game too Good for Mobile.
love the graphics and how unique the game is. it does not work with my ps4 dual shock controller though and on my Android TV you have to connect a mouse to get past the menu.

Awesome platformer, great controls even with a touchscreen. The art/graphics has a great style and it's really challenging and fun.
Fun game! Gameplay is good, puzzles are entertaining. Animations are a bit on the weak side. Better than the average Android game for sure.
when I connect the game controller I could move it freely but I can't use the equipment please fix it

the best game!!!
Nice game but becomes so hard with the controls at some point, that you want to give up... At least that's what I did. Maybe I ll try again at some point if I get a controller 🎮

Beautiful game, enjoyably challenging for the most part. The only big downside is the control scheme is awful. Dash is required for quite a lot of puzzles but is one of the most infuriating to pull off.
Great concept and artwork. controls are finicky.

overall I think this game is a great game and I did finally get past that first boss but I tell you what this is a challenging game with good controls and a very good story line so bring the updates and keep it coming thanks devs great job!
graphics are phenominal, controls not so good
I love the game. one of the best mobile game.

It could be a more fun and relaxing game, but the on-screen controls conspire against that. I haven't played the original on PC, but the on-screen controls make the game unnecessarily challenging. Sometimes I have to use both hands on the right side to jump and maneuver powers, not leaving me enough hands to move the character.
Excellent
awesome puzzle platformer great controls. was very surprised at how well put gogetber it is!

Very good Game. Some parts are really hard, never knew they could be solved at first. But eventually, I finished the game, so I guess they are possible. I think there are multiple endings though... the blank second page of the map and the "36x" graffiti seems to imply so. Definitely going to replay the game, but this time, by reading walkthroughs. But I have to agree with others that the controls are not very precise (pressing up, can cause character to go left or right for ex). I am using a G4S.
Fantastic puzzle platformer.
This was all going so well until I hit the forge level, then the frame rate just died and made the game impssible to play. It would be five stars if there were no frame rate issues.

content: controls are good very impressed keep up the good work !!!!

Inconsistent physics, imprecise, "floaty" hardware gamepad controls, unintuitive, frustrating puzzles (w/mediocre hints), & this was at the beginning of the game. No cloud saves, and the start menu features confusing "box" icons that don't show if they're selected clearly. As a fan of Metroidvania games, I cannot recommend this game to anyone, unless they love irritating, rage-quit platformers like "Super Meat Boy", etc. EDIT: - Contrary to the dev's response, the controls have NOT been fixed.
replyContent:
Hello,
We have released a new update of Teslagrad, where you can deactivate the floating pad, thus giving you more options for the controls. :) Thank you for your feedback, and we hope you enjoy the game!

content: Beautiful artstyle but held back by insanely floaty controls. A platformer is all about the controls, especially when you have to make tight jumps. content: Teslagrad is definitely a fresh breathe of air amongst Android games. It sticks out in a mire of third person and 2.5d beat-em-ups with innumerable currencies and idle clicker games. And well it should, seeing as it's a port of an indie console game. That said, its history on the console rings true, both in good and bad ways. The style and ambiance generated by its design is wonderful, and illustrates its atmosphere perfectly. The gameplay mechanics are uniquely derived, using electromagnetism as its driving theme, which also plays well in boss fights. It almost makes me want to play this with a controller. Alas, therein lies the problem. Its console roots shine through in the mobile port, as the controls are not as exacting as a pad or joystick would be. Sometimes I find my thumb drag moving the young boy you play a hair too eschew to his demise. It's also aggravating to find no controller layout options for users with irregular fingers or larger devices. The inaccuracy goes on to make gameplay already designed to accentuate the clear possibility of failure that much harder, returning the player to checkpoints when he's caught by enemies or touches a hazard. While this might be seen as a Dark Souls-like challenge on console, it can become frustrating on mobile. One example is during a section where, in order to traverse over an electrified statue, the player must affect and rely on pillbug-esque NPCs to react in the exact way you hope to thus guide the player over the hazard. The player's only recourse is to wait until all things align and hope the game reads his jump+charge correctly, and not as a dash into a hazard. Overlooking those glaring moments, the game's environmental storytelling, puzzles, and overall design make it an interesting time and a great time-waster.
Great concept and wonderful ideas.

Really fun game. Rich story and really nice artwork/game design. Controls are a little hard when trying to do complex moves. Can get frustrating some times. Also, really makes you think and use problem solving skills. Overall 8.5/10. Buy while it is still on sale.

content: Controls are fine without a controller which is the one thing I was worried about but happy to see that it's not an issue! Haven't played this before but heard good things. Only 20 minutes into it but loving it so far. Doubt I'll change the review lol Thank you guys for making me aware of this game in the Android gaming subreddit, and for bringing such a quality game to mobile. Not everybody has a console, it's nice to have a similar experience in my pocket.

Game had no onscreen controls in the initial launch version. They replied to my issue promptly and had a fix in hours. Doesn't get any better than that. Now that I can play the game I can say the graphics look great. I usually never pay attention to the music or sounds but they are also fantastic. So far this is a great puzzle platformer. Game has you being chased by grown ups teaching you the controls, then you hit the first puzzle section. This consists of changing the polarity of blocks to make them raise or lower to open up your path to the next section. Checkpoints so far are generous so restarting a section usually does not require a ton of backtracking. This also is great for short sessions which I can appreciate, since my chunks of free time are small. So far I'm enjoying the game a lot and can recommend it to fans of the genre. No in app purchases, the one time price gets you the full game.
